intro: Avena almeriensis, commonly known as the Almería oat, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets. Avena almeriensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in Mediterranean climates. It is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop.
